none: Northwestern vs. Indiana and Northwestern vs. Minnesota
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music

Two performances by the Northwestern University Marching Band during the 1985 season. First, the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Indiana Hoosiers in Bloomington, Indiana. Halftime performances include "You're a Grand Old Flag" and "Yankee Doodle Dandy" as part of a tribute to Indiana Hoosiers and "Sing, Sing, Sing." The Indiana Marching Band performs the music of George and Ira Gershwin including "American in Paris ballet," "I've Got Rhythm," "Summertime," and "Oh Lord, I'm On My Way." Both bands participate in a postgame show featuring "Indiana Our Indiana," "Go U Northwestern," "I've Got Rhythm," "Theme from Shaft," "Summertime," "Oh Lord, I'm On My Way," and "Georgia On My Mind." John P. Paynter then conducts the Northwestern Marching Band for "Alma Mater." The second performance is from the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Minnesota Gophers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The NUMB Alums from 1930-1985 begin the pregame performances with "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern University Marching Band, conducted by Dale Lonis, performs the National Anthem, "Minnesota Rouser," "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." The Northwestern Homecoming performances include "Sing, Sing, Sing," Don Owens conducting the Vocal Jazz Ensemble in "Birdland," and the NUMB alums joining the marching band for "Bill Bailey Won't You Please Come Home." John P. Paynter then conducts Alma Mater. Postgame performances by the NU Marching Band include "Minnesota Rouser," "Go U Northwestern," "Yankee Doodle Dandy," "You're a Grand Old Flag," "When the Saints Go Marching In," "Fame," "Bill Bailey Won't You Please Come Home," and "Alma Mater."

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
